posts.post_content: Severely underrated right now. Defends himself and you with his +1, digs pretty damn well for you with -2, and uses your opponent's deck against him with his -8, as well as fishing out your biggest bomb. Realistically, there is absolutely no way this should be under 4/5 right now.

posts.post_content:
this jace is much better designed than the other ones. the first jace had an ultimate that was never used. JTMS was broken and should never of had 4 abilities. the third jace had abilities that weren't really intuitive (lazy design).   
  
this jace on the other hand is clearly for multiplayer, and it performs well in that area. the abilities are interesting and not overpowered. I applaud WotC.

posts.post_content:
@Lash\_of\_Dragonbreath  
You're either underestimating this card, or overestimating [Chandra Ablaze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra Ablaze), or both. Chandra Ablaze was weak because it costed 6 CMC, and for that much, you're really looking for something that immediately contributes to winning the game. She just didn't do enough for her cost. Jace, Architect of Thought costs 4 CMC. The difference is night and day. I suspect that if Chandra Ablaze were to cost 4 CMC, she would be a quite popular and powerful planeswalker, instead of merely being a casual card.

posts.post_content:
Great card. Took the mana cost of [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor) and splices it well with abilities that aren't broken as Hell. I'd like to emphasize the obvious nerfing of [Fact or Fiction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fact or Fiction). They acknowledge that Jace needs to be good but not incredible. Well costed but not broken for the cost. They took Jace Beleren (well costed), Jace, Memory Adept (powerful) and the cost of Jace, the Mind Sculptor (just as a tribute to the undisputed king), and spliced them well.  
But *terrible* art.  
5/5 though.
posts.html:

Posted By: gman92 (9/26/2012 4:52:38 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Let's take a look at Jace's second ability:
  
   
If your opponent splits the piles really well, you get the best card out of 3 draws.
  
If your opponent makes a mistake, you get the 2 best cards out of 3 draws.
  
   
Now here's the thing:
  
Jace's second ability can be used twice over two turns (more if you stall the game and power him up with the +1 ability). This strategy seems very solid.
  
   
Add the other abilities; the fact that Jace powers-up by shutting down infinite sized 1/1 armies is incredible; especially since the fixed artifact [Cumber Stone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cumber Stone) was also 4 mana to do the same thing, but that card didn't have all these other options!
  
   
If the game gets stalled for too long, Jace has his ultimate. Last time I checked, Blue was more than happy to stall the game with white cards that use Detain or [Supreme Verdict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Supreme Verdict).
posts.html:
Let's take a look at Jace's second ability:

If your opponent splits the piles really well, you get the best card out of 3 draws.
If your opponent makes a mistake, you get the 2 best cards out of 3 draws.

Now here's the thing:
Jace's second ability can be used twice over two turns (more if you stall the game and power him up with the +1 ability). This strategy seems very solid.

Add the other abilities; the fact that Jace powers-up by shutting down infinite sized 1/1 armies is incredible; especially since the fixed artifact Cumber Stone was also 4 mana to do the same thing, but that card didn't have all these other options!

If the game gets stalled for too long, Jace has his ultimate. Last time I checked, Blue was more than happy to stall the game with white cards that use Detain or Supreme Verdict.
